name: Mariusz Jan Skobel
profile_summary: Dynamic Network Engineer with over 10 years of experience in managing and optimizing network infrastructures, demonstrating a strong expertise in **Cisco**, **Routing Protocols**, **BGP**, **OSPF**, **EIGRP**, **VLANs**, **VPNs**, and **Cisco IOS**. Adept at executing **Physical Network Migrations** and overseeing **Data Centre Operations** with a focus on ensuring high availability and performance. Proven problem-solving skills with a little-known ability to communicate complex technical ideas clearly to stakeholders. Strong foundation in **Cisco NX-OS**, **Cisco ASA**, and **Cisco Meraki**, bringing experience in documentation and best practices to maintain compliance and security. Passionate about leveraging networking technologies to enhance performance and resilience in enterprise environments.

experience.responsibilities:

• Managed and monitored enterprise routing protocols including **BGP**, **OSPF**, and **EIGRP** to maintain high availability and performance in network services, achieving 99.9% uptime across data centers.
• Led physical network migrations with minimal downtime, successfully transitioning 10+ data centers to new architectures while ensuring seamless connectivity for over **500** users.
• Created comprehensive documentation for network configurations and protocols to facilitate knowledge sharing and compliance with industry standards, aiding in incident response and problem-solving for teams.
• Collaborated with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot and resolve networking issues, improving communication and support processes, achieving a 30% reduction in response times.
• Conducted training sessions for junior network engineers on best practices in **Cisco** technology and routing protocols, enhancing team capability and knowledge sharing.
• Participated in the review and improvement of network policies, contributing to the streamlining of documentation processes that reduced administrative workload by **25%**.
• Implemented solutions for data center operations that included disaster recovery strategies and network optimization practices, resulting in a **15%** increase in operational efficiency.
